verses.kjv: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
verses.ct: I will celebrate the mercy of the LORD forever; with my own voice I will declare your faithfulness to every generation.

verses.kjv: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.
verses.ct: I have declared that your mercy stands firm forever — you have established your faithfulness in the very heavens.

verses.kjv: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,
verses.ct: God said, 'I have made a covenant with the one I chose; I have made a solemn promise to my servant David:

verses.kjv: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
verses.ct: "I will establish your descendants forever and secure your throne through every generation."' Selah.

verses.kjv: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
verses.ct: The heavens celebrate your wonders, LORD — your faithfulness is praised in the assembly of the holy ones.

verses.kjv: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
verses.ct: Who in the heavens can compare to the LORD? What heavenly being is anything like the LORD?

verses.kjv: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.
verses.ct: God is deeply revered in the council of the holy ones, and held in awe by all who surround him.

verses.kjv: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?
verses.ct: LORD God of Armies, who is as mighty as you? Your faithfulness surrounds you on every side.

verses.kjv: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
verses.ct: You control the raging sea; when its waves surge upward, you calm them.

verses.kjv: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
verses.ct: You crushed Rahab like a slaughtered corpse; with your powerful arm you scattered your enemies.

verses.kjv: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
verses.ct: The heavens belong to you, and the earth is yours as well — you laid the foundation of the world and everything in it.

verses.kjv: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
verses.ct: You created the north and the south; Tabor and Hermon sing for joy at your name.

verses.kjv: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
verses.ct: Your arm is filled with power; your hand is strong, and your right hand is raised high.

verses.kjv: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
verses.ct: Justice and righteousness form the foundation of your throne; mercy and truth go ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
verses.ct: How happy are the people who know the shout of celebration — they live, LORD, in the light of your presence.

verses.kjv: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
verses.ct: They find joy in your name all day long, and through your righteousness they are lifted up.

verses.kjv: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
verses.ct: You are the source of their strength and glory, and by your favor our power is raised high.

verses.kjv: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
verses.ct: The LORD himself is our shield, and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

verses.kjv: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
verses.ct: Long ago you spoke in a vision to your faithful one and said, 'I have given strength to a warrior; I have raised up someone chosen from among the people.

verses.kjv: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
verses.ct: I found my servant David and anointed him with my sacred oil.

verses.kjv: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
verses.ct: My hand will support him firmly, and my arm will make him strong.

verses.kjv: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
verses.ct: No enemy will force tribute from him, and no wicked person will oppress him.

verses.kjv: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
verses.ct: I will crush his opponents in front of him and strike down those who hate him.

verses.kjv: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
verses.ct: My faithfulness and mercy will stay with him, and through my name his power will be raised high.

verses.kjv: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
verses.ct: I will extend his authority over the sea and his dominion over the rivers.

verses.kjv: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
verses.ct: He will call out to me, "You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation."

verses.kjv: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
verses.ct: I will also make him my firstborn — the highest of all the kings on earth.

verses.kjv: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
verses.ct: I will maintain my mercy toward him forever, and my covenant with him will never be broken.

verses.kjv: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
verses.ct: I will make his descendants last forever, and his throne will endure as long as the heavens exist.

verses.kjv: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
verses.ct: If his descendants abandon my law and refuse to follow my regulations,

verses.kjv: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
verses.ct: if they violate my statutes and fail to keep my commandments,

verses.kjv: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
verses.ct: then I will punish their rebellion with the rod and their wrongdoing with beatings.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
verses.ct: But I will never completely withdraw my faithful love from him, and I will not let my faithfulness prove false.

verses.kjv: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
verses.ct: I will not violate my covenant or change what I have already spoken.

verses.kjv: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
verses.ct: Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness — I will not lie to David.

verses.kjv: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
verses.ct: His descendants will continue forever, and his throne will endure like the sun in my sight.

verses.kjv: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
verses.ct: It will stand firm forever like the moon — a reliable witness in the heavens.' Selah.

verses.kjv: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
verses.ct: But you have rejected and cast aside your anointed one — you have been angry with him.

verses.kjv: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
verses.ct: You have thrown out the covenant with your servant and hurled his crown into the dirt.

verses.kjv: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
verses.ct: You have torn down all his walls and left his fortresses in ruins.

verses.kjv: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.
verses.ct: Everyone who passes by robs him; he has become an object of mockery to his neighbors.

verses.kjv: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
verses.ct: You have strengthened his enemies and made all his opponents celebrate.

verses.kjv: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
verses.ct: You have turned back the edge of his sword and refused to support him in battle.

verses.kjv: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
verses.ct: You have stripped away his splendor and thrown his throne to the ground.

verses.kjv: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
verses.ct: You have cut short the days of his youth and wrapped him in disgrace. Selah.

verses.kjv: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
verses.ct: How long, LORD? Will you stay hidden forever? Will your anger keep burning like fire?

verses.kjv: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?
verses.ct: Remember how brief my life is! Did you create all people only to die for nothing?

verses.kjv: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
verses.ct: What person can live and never experience death? Who can rescue their own soul from the grip of the grave? Selah.

verses.kjv: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
verses.ct: Lord, where is the faithful love you showed before — the love you swore to David in your trustworthiness?

verses.kjv: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
verses.ct: Remember, Lord, how your servants are mocked; I carry in my heart the insults of so many nations.

verses.kjv: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
verses.ct: Your enemies have hurled their insults, LORD — they have mocked every step of your anointed one.

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD forever! Amen and amen.
